fine_dining.name: Arcadas at Quinta das Lágrimas
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining in an 18th-century palace with garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request a table with garden views; book at least a week in advance, especially on weekends
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Portugal's most prestigious restaurants, considered among the top 500 in the world; try their signature wine 'Pedro & Inês'; part of their ingredients come from their own organic garden.

fine_dining.name: Refeitro da Baixa
fine_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary dining in a renovated ceramics factory with glass walls showing the workshop
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book via TheFork app; ask for a table near the glass walls to watch ceramic artisans at work
fine_dining.local_tips: Housed in a restored ceramics factory from 1824; excellent for trying modern interpretations of traditional Portuguese dishes; pairs well with wines from the nearby Bairrada region.

fine_dining.name: Loggia
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining with panoramic city views from Machado de Castro Museum
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve a terrace table for the best views over Coimbra, especially at sunset
fine_dining.local_tips: One of the best views in the city; located in the former Bishop's Palace; combines cultural visit with fine dining as you can explore the museum before your meal.

casual_dining.name: Zé Manel dos Ossos
signature_dishes: Quim dos Ossos (Spine Bones in Peppery Broth)
Feijoada de Javali (Wild Boar Bean Stew)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Tiny, rustic tavern with walls covered in handwritten notes from patrons
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations accepted; arrive early (before opening) or be prepared to wait; cash only
casual_dining.local_tips: Coimbra's most famous restaurant; walls decorated with poems, student capes, and mementos; tiny space with only 6 tables; authentic regional cooking without pretense; frequented by locals and visitors alike.

casual_dining.name: Tapas nas Costas
signature_dishes: Selection of Portuguese Cheeses and Charcuterie
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy tavern in the historic Quebra-Costas area
casual_dining.booking_tips: Small venue; arrive early for dinner service
casual_dining.local_tips: Located in one of Coimbra's most charming historic streets; excellent for sharing multiple small plates; good selection of Portuguese wines by the glass; perfect for sampling variety of Portuguese flavors.

casual_dining.name: A Taberna
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, intimate dining room with simple decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular with locals for celebrations; book in advance
casual_dining.local_tips: Known for bringing a selection of six side dishes to choose from with main courses; generous portions; consistently high quality traditional food; homestyle Portuguese cooking at its best.

casual_dining.name: Dux Taberna Urbana
casual_dining.booking_tips: Can get busy on weekends; counter seating available for solo diners
casual_dining.local_tips: Excellent wine selection focusing on Portuguese varieties; perfect for trying multiple small dishes; popular with local wine enthusiasts; good option for informal dining with quality ingredients.

street_food.name: Fangas Veg
street_food.local_tips: Former grocery store turned vegetarian restaurant; excellent for vegetarians looking for traditional Portuguese flavors; mix and match small plates to create your ideal meal; reservation recommended as seating is limited.

street_food.name: O Afonso
street_food.local_tips: Great place for traditional pastries and coffee; try the regional specialties like Arrufadas de Coimbra (sweet bread); popular with locals for breakfast or afternoon snack.

street_food.name: Sete Restaurant
street_food.local_tips: Honest, flavorful food at reasonable prices; popular with students and locals; set lunch menus offer excellent value; outdoor tables great for people-watching in summer months.

coffee_shops.name: Café Santa Cruz
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Majestic historic café with vaulted ceilings and stained glass windows
coffee_shops.local_tips: Housed in a former 16th-century chapel with spectacular Manueline architecture; live music some evenings; iconic Coimbra institution since 1923; perfect spot to experience the city's café culture.

coffee_shops.name: Doppo Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, minimalist café with bright interiors
coffee_shops.local_tips: Best specialty coffee in Coimbra; double threat with excellent Italian gelato; popular with students and coffee enthusiasts; good workspace for digital nomads.

coffee_shops.name: Pastelaria Briosa
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Portuguese pastelaria serving customers since 1955
coffee_shops.food_options: Full range of Portuguese pastries and breads
coffee_shops.local_tips: Iconic bakery serving authentic regional pastries; award-winning sweet treats; best place to sample Coimbra's traditional convent sweets; centrally located near Largo da Portagem.

bars.name: Passaporte Lounge Bar
bars.atmosphere: Sophisticated rooftop lounge with panoramic city views
bars.local_tips: One of the best viewpoints in Coimbra; sunset drinks can turn into dinner; stylish setting in a historic manor; popular with both visitors and locals for special occasions.

bars.name: Fado ao Centro
bars.atmosphere: Authentic fado venue with daily performances
bars.local_tips: Cultural center dedicated to preserving Coimbra's unique male-sung fado tradition; informative presentations about the history and significance of this UNESCO-recognized music style; intimate performances by skilled musicians.

bars.name: Aqui Base Tango
bars.atmosphere: Energetic student bar with academic traditions
bars.local_tips: Authentic student bar experience; popular with university students; occasional live music; good place to experience Coimbra's famous academic atmosphere; often packed during term time.

bars.name: Trovador Bar
signature_drinks: Local wines from Bairrada and Dão regions
bars.atmosphere: Cozy wine bar with rustic Portuguese decor
bars.local_tips: Excellent for discovering Portuguese wines, especially from nearby regions; knowledgeable staff can guide your selections; relaxed atmosphere perfect for conversation; occasional fado nights.

food_tours.name: Coimbra Gastronomy Walk
highlights: Regional specialties like Chanfana and Leitão à Bairrada
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a few days in advance; comfortable walking shoes recommended; includes stops at historic eateries in the university district.

food_tours.name: Bairrada Wine Region Tour
highlights: Traditional Leitão à Bairrada (suckling pig) lunch
food_tours.booking_tips: Departs from Coimbra; includes transportation to nearby Bairrada region (20-30 minutes); focuses on the region's famous sparkling wines and roast suckling pig specialty; advance booking essential.

food_tours.name: Sweet Coimbra Tour
highlights: Sampling of regional sweets including Pastéis de Santa Clara and Pastéis de Tentúgal
food_tours.booking_tips: Sweet-focused tour perfect for those with a sweet tooth; includes coffee pairings; explores the fascinating history of Portugal's convent-based pastry traditions.

cooking_classes.name: Traditional Coimbra Cooking Workshop
what_you_learn: Regional desserts like Pastéis de Santa Clara
includes: Market visit, all ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal with regional wines
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Hands-on class focusing on Coimbra's iconic dishes; includes visit to the local market; vegetarian options available with advance notice; book at least a week ahead.

cooking_classes.name: Portuguese Pastry Masterclass
what_you_learn: Techniques for making Pastéis de Santa Clara
includes: All ingredients, sweet wine pairing, take-home box of pastries you make
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Focused on the sweet side of Portuguese cuisine; learn about the fascinating history of convent-based pastry traditions; perfect for baking enthusiasts; suitable for all skill levels.

markets.name: Mercado Municipal D. Pedro V
markets.local_tips: The best place to see local food culture in action; visit early morning for the freshest selection and to see locals shopping; ground floor contains produce vendors while upper floor has small restaurants serving market-fresh ingredients.

markets.name: Praça do Comércio Market
markets.hours: Shops typically open 9 AM - 7 PM, Restaurant hours vary
markets.local_tips: Historic commercial square with specialty food shops; hosts flea market on the fourth Saturday of each month; surrounded by traditional restaurants serving regional cuisine; perfect for souvenir shopping and experiencing local commerce.

markets.name: Quebra Costas Food Shops
markets.hours: Varies by shop, typically 10 AM - 7 PM
markets.local_tips: Collection of small specialty food shops along one of Coimbra's most picturesque streets; great for assembling picnic supplies or food souvenirs; many shops offer tastings; combine food shopping with exploring the historic upper town.

summer: Leitão à Bairrada (Roast Suckling Pig from nearby Bairrada region)
Seasonal Fruit Desserts featuring Cherries and Berries
autumn: Javali (Wild Boar Stew with local mushrooms)
winter: Regional Bean Stews and Hearty Meat Dishes
Traditional Convent Sweets like Pastéis de Santa Clara and Pastéis de Tentúgal
